title: Post-Quantum Cryptography Migration for Fintechs
problem_statement: Fintech companies face an urgent need to migrate to post-quantum cryptography (PQC) to protect sensitive financial data from future quantum attacks. This transition presents significant technical, operational, and financial challenges that require strategic planning and execution.
key_questions: What are the most viable post-quantum cryptographic algorithms for typical fintech applications?
What are the primary technical, operational, and compliance challenges fintechs face during PQC migration?
What strategic frameworks and best practices can guide a secure and efficient PQC transition for fintechs?
method_brief: Conduct a comprehensive literature review on PQC standards, algorithms, and existing migration frameworks.
Analyze current cryptographic practices and infrastructure within the fintech sector.
Interview fintech security experts and PQC implementers to gather practical insights and challenges.
Develop a phased migration roadmap and best practice guidelines tailored for fintechs.
deliverables: A detailed report on PQC readiness, challenges, and opportunities for fintechs.
A practical PQC migration framework and roadmap for fintech implementation.
Recommendations for suitable PQC algorithms and implementation strategies.
